data.title: Star Soldier - Vanishing Earth - Videogame by Seta
data.meta_description: Star Soldier - Vanishing Earth is a Videogame by Seta (circa 1998). A space shooter with 64-bit graphics.
data.text:
This unusual arcade game system is cartridge based and it incorporates very specialized controls. The mother board does not use any of the usual control inputs, except for coins one and two. It looks for two special control sets while it is booting. If they are not found, the game will not work.

The controls are a dual/convertable 8-way joystick and a digital-analog joystick. The optics are like those found on a 360 degree steering wheel so it could be considered a two-in-one joystick. The special joystick is a digital control where it combines the Up, Down, Left, Right, 1, 2, 3, 4 and Start input signals into a single data line that runs straight to the mother board. So all input signals go through the special joystick circuit board and then to the 3 position connector (blue and white) -- see picture.

There are only three known cartridges for this system:

Star Soldier - Vanishing Earth will work with either analog or 8-way controls.

Eleven Beat World Tournament (Soccer) will only play with the analog setting of the controls.

Vivid Dolls is a strip type game similar to Gals Panic

DIP switch bank 1 switch 8 sets the joystick type. DIP switch bank 2 switch 8 enables self test mode.
